question.text:
What words will correct fill a, b, c, and d in the following paragraph?

a develops into a pollen grain. The outer layer is b and inner layer is intine. The inner layer is made up of cellulose and c . In 60% of the angiosperms, pollen grains are shed at d celled stage.

options.text: <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  - Anther,  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  - Exine,   <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  - Chitin,  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  -  3

<math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  - Microspore,  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  - Exine,  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  - Chitin,  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  - 2

<math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  - Anther,  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  - Exine,  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  -  Pectin,  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  - 2

<math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> - Microspore, <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> - Exine, <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> - Pectin, <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> - 2

solution.text: The microspore develops into a pollen grain. The outer layer is exine. The inner layer is called intine and it is made up of cellulose and pectin. In 60% angiosperms, pollen grains shed at 2 - celled stage. In others, they are shed at 3 celled stages as the generative cell divides mitotically to form 2 male gametes.
